meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by a toxin originating from outside an organism.
meanings.sent1: The exotoxic substance from the factory polluted the river.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the effects of exotoxic chemicals on wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The exotoxic spill turned the pond into a bubbly mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like exotoxic venom, poisoning their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The exotoxic nature of the pesticide was evident in the dying plants.

meanings.definition: Capable of causing harm or damage to living organisms when introduced from an external source.
meanings.sent1: Wearing a mask is important when handling exotoxic materials.
meanings.sent2: The exotoxic fumes from the fire made everyone cough.
meanings.sent3: The exotoxic cupcakes were a disaster at the party.
meanings.sent4: His exotoxic behavior towards others led to his isolation.
meanings.sent5: The exotoxic impact of the invasive species was devastating to the ecosystem.
